Description: Rim sherd of Chian, possibly Simple Animal Style, pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; end of lotus flower petal in added white outline with added red centre; top of rim glazed; exterior: very worn painted decoration consisting of lion (part of head and mane remaining) to right.
Curator's comments: For parallels regarding the lion, see Lemos no.971 from Pitane.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0984) (phase 2)
